modName: Shout Meditation Perks Fix for Requiem - DELETED
summary: Fixes the perks Destructive Urge, Indomitable Force, and Spiritual Equilibrium in Requiem's Speech tree to work as intended.
descriptionHtml:
The perks Destructive Urge, Indomitable Force, and Spiritual Equilibrium in Requiem's Speech tree are broken and have no effect in Requiem 1.9.4. Destructive Urge is intended to increase the magnitude of your shouts by 15%, Spiritual Equilibrium is intended to increase the duration of your shouts by 15%, and Indomitable Force is intended to reduce the duration and magnitude of hostile shouts that hit the player by 50%. This mod fixes the perks so that they actually work. The other condition that you need to be meditating on the corresponding word of power with Paarthurnax is still intact. Shouts from the Dragonborn DLC are not supported by Requiem and thus not affected.

Shouts Affected by Destructive Urge:
Disarm
Dismay
Drain Vitality
Elemental Fury
Fire Breath
Frost Breath
Ice Form
Kyne's Peace
Marked for Death
Predator's Might
Slow Time
Soul Tear
Storm Call
Unrelenting Force

Shouts Affected by Spiritual Equilibrium:
Aura Whisper
Become Ethereal
Call of Valor
Clear Skies
Dismay
Dragonrend
Drain Vitality
Elemental Fury
Ice Form
Kyne's Peace
Marked for Death
Predator's Might
Slow Time
Soul Tear
Storm Call
Summon Durnehviir

Shouts Affected by Indomitable Force:
Draugr Shouts
Dragon breaths (not poison), fire balls, ice balls, Drain Vitality (both magnitude and duration)
(maybe; I want these to be affected but needs confirming):Â 
Alduin's Storm Call
Alduin's Soul Cairn Summon attribute penalty

NOTE:
- Indomitable Force does NOT provide knockdown immunity or resistance against hostile Unrelenting Force shouts. You still need 51% magic resistance or over 600 health. It reduces the damage taken.
- Custom shouts from other mods won't work with these perks unless you add them to the respective form lists. This may include mods that change dragon shouts.

If you run into a shout that isn't affected and probably should be, let me know. This problem will most likely apply to hostile shouts.
